episode_title: 510 - The One With The Inappropriate Sister

content.description: Chandler, Joey, and Ross’s apartment, Ross is cleaning out the fridge. Joey walks from his room. He looks like he just woke up.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What are you doing?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I…reorganized the fridge. See, bottom shelf: meats and dairy. (There’s nothing on the shelf.) Middle shelf: fruits and vegetables. (There’s one lone tomato.) And top shelf: expired products. (The shelf is jammed packed.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Why are you doing this?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Because I am bored…Out of my mind. I’ve already been to the bank, post office, and the dry cleaners.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Dude, you just described seven days worth of stuff. You’ve got to spread it out a little, you know. Haven’t you ever been unemployed?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey, I am not unemployed . I’m on sabbatical!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, don’t get religious on me, ok. (Ross looks a little confused.) A guy in your position needs to be a little better at relaxing. You know. Why do you think we have the comfortable chairs? Huh…come here…sit down. (Ross sits down.) Ready? (Joey flips the foot rest up.) Ahh!! (He reclines the chair fully.) Ohh, yeah!! Huh?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: So what, we just sit?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ohh, no, no. We’re not going to just sit. (Joey sits down and hits the speed dial button on the phone.) Shhh. (It begins to ring.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hello, Chandler Bing.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hello Mr. Bing…I love you.
content.parenthetical: In a high pitched female voice

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Alright, whoever this is, stop calling me! (Ross and Joey laugh silently.) It’s been six months! It’s not funny!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: But, I love you .

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Leave me alone! For the love of God, leave me alone!!! (Joey hangs up.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: And that’s Wednesday. (He reclines in his chair.) Ohh.

content.description: Central Perk, Chandler, Ross, Joey, Monica, and Rachel are there. Phoebe walks in ringing a bell.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey you guys, guess what?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: The British are coming?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ohh, you and your ways. (She shakes the bell at him and sits down.) Since it’s Christmastime. I’m going to be one of those people collection donations.

content.speaker: All
content.text: Ohh.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, I already have my bell and later on…I get my bucket.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ohh.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, yeah, I’m going to be out there spreading joy to the people. I mean, last year, I spread a little joy but not really enough. So this year, I’m going to do the whole city.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You know, I knew a girl in high school who did that. She was very popular. (Chandler laughs.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: So Pheebs, where are you doing all, your bell ringing?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ohh, they gave me a great spot. Right by Macys . Yeah, they hardly ever give such a good spot to a rookie, but I’m the only one who can sing “Merry Christmas” in 25 languages. (She smirks.) I lied.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh my god. Ok you guys, there’s Danny. Watch. Just watch this. (He walks past the couch to the counter.) See?! Still pretending he’s not interested. Ohh, he’s coming over. Just pretend like we don’t know him. We’ve forgotten who he is.

content.speaker: Danny
content.text: Hey guys.

content.speaker: All
content.text: Hey Danny.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Danny? You know Rachel? She’s nice. She’s not bad to look at, right?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Thanks, Mon.

content.speaker: Danny
content.text: Well, of course.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Do you want to go out on a date with her?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Monica!!!

content.speaker: Danny
content.text: Absolutely! Is Friday okay?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Friday’s perfect…She can’t wait.

content.speaker: Danny
content.text: On the date, I will be able to talk to her directly? (To Rachel) See ya Friday. (He walks out.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay. What the hell was that? You know what? Don’t answer me. (Giggling) I have a date with Danny.

content.description: Estelle’s (Joey’s Agent) Office, Joey is there.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: How could I not get the part? The play was about a 29-year-old Italian actor from Queens.

content.speaker: Estelle
content.text: Well, Telia Shire suddenly became available.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: She’s a woman!

content.speaker: Estelle
content.text: What can I say? She nailed it.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay, is there anything else?

content.speaker: Estelle
content.text: Well, you’re just going to say no again but…gay porn.

content.description: [Scene: In front of Macys, Phoebe is collecting donations and ringing her bell.]

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Happy Holidays. Feliz Navidad. Allo, and Merry Christmas. (A man put some change in her bucket.) Ohh thank you sir. Here’s some joy. (She waves her hand up and down as if she is spreading joy.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Phoebe!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I just wanted to see how it’s going.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, it’s going okay.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well good, here let me help you out.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, thanks!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Wow!
(Monica puts some change in Phoebe’s bucket.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Is that a new Swede jacket? It looks really expensive.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah. I guess. (She puts more money in the bucket.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Just get your nails done?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yes Phoebe, but this is all I have. Okay? (She pours out the rest of her change purse into the bucket.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay! Thanks! Happy Holidays, here’s your joy. (She waves her arm and spreads her joy.)
(A man walks up and puts a dollar bill in.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Thank you! And Happy Holidays.
(The man starts to take some change out.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Wait, you can’t take the money out.

content.speaker: The Man
content.text: I’m making change. I need change for the bus.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: But, can’t you leave the dollar? This money is for the poor.

content.speaker: The Man
content.text: I’m poor! I gotta take the bus!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, Seasons Greetings and everything, but still…

content.speaker: The Man
content.text: Bite me, blondie! (The man storms off.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, I’m going to give him something else besides joy, just… (She scowls at him.)

content.description: Chandler, Joey, and Ross’s, Joey is telling Ross how he didn’t get the part.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: That part was perfect for me! I can’t believe I didn’t get it!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I’m sorry, man. Hey, y’know what you should do? You should make something happen for yourself. Y’know, like-like write a play. Write a movie! Huh? I mean, what about those Good Will Hunting guys?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Come on Ross be realistic, y’know? If I did write something, what are the chances I could get those guys to star in it?
(Ross just stares at him until he figures it out.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Wait a second, I could star in it!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Or that.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I can’t write! Y’know I mean I-I-I’m an actor, I don’t have the discipline that takes, y’know? I can’t do it.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I’ll help you. Yeah, I’ll make up a schedule and make sure you stick to it. And plus, it’ll give me something to do.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Really? You’d-you’d do that for me?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Thanks!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: All right, we’ll start off slow. The only thing you have to do tonight is come up with the name of your main character.
content.parenthetical: grabbing a notepad and sitting down

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Done!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: And it can’t be Joey.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: It’s not.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Or Joseph.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh.

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Rachel is returning. Monica enters from her room wearing nothing but a robe.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey, what’s up?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I just saw Danny getting on the subway with a girl and he had his arm around her.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, honey, I’m sorry.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, you should be, this is all your fault! You meddled in our relationship!!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You had no relationship!!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No, but I was doing my thing and everything was going according to the plan!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh God, stop with the plan! So what, so what you saw him with a girl? Who cares?! That doesn’t mean anything! Now look, you’re going to go out on a date with Danny and you’re going to be so charming he’s gonna forget all about that stupid subway girl.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: She was kinda stupid. You’re right. All right, I’m just gonna go on the date. I’m gonna go on the date. That is the new plan.
(Rachel goes into her room and closes the door. Which allows Monica to let Chandler out of her room.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Come on, hurry!
(Chandler runs out the door and closes it behind him. After a short pause the door opens and Chandler comes rushing back through, grabs Monica, kisses her good-bye, and heads back out.)

content.description: Chandler, Joey, and Ross’s, Joey is trying to write his movie, Chandler is playing a game on the counter by trying to flip a ping pong ball with a spoon into a nearby bowl.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, how do you spell suspicious?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Why?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Because I think this character is going to be suspicious about stuff.
(Chandler makes it into the bowl.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yes! Chandler Bing, 7! Chandler Bing , 0.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You’re driving me crazy with that!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, I’ll stop.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Don’t stop! Move the bowl further away! Ross could make that shot!
(Chandler slides the bowl to the far end of the counter. He tries again, but he hits the spoon to hard and the ball goes flying away.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, you suck! But at least you suck at a man’s game now.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You wanna play?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Chandler, I can’t be playing games, Ross is gonna be home soon. And I have to write five whole pages if I’m gonna stick to his schedule.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, so, play for the next 30 minutes and then write until he gets home.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All right! But uh, listen, what do you say we crank it up a notch?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I’m intrigued.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All right, all we need is a little lighter fluid.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, but be careful okay, because I wanna get our security deposit back.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, I think we said good-bye to that when we invented hammer darts.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Do you even remember which part of the wall is not spackle?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Uh yeah, right here. (He punches his fist through the wall next to the door.)

content.description: [Scene: In front of Macys, Phoebe is still ringing her bell. A guy puts some change into the bucket.]

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Thank you, Happy Holidays.
(Another woman walks up and throws something into the bucket.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Now, that’s trash. Young lady, you can’t… (The lady ignores her and walks off.) Hey! Stop that young lady, she donated trash!
(Another guy walks by and throws his light cigarette butt in the bucket.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey!! (The bucket starts smoking.) The charity’s on fire! Help! (Yet another guy walks by carrying a cup, which Phoebe grabs.) Oh good! Thank you, I need that. (She throws onto the smoldering fire. Suddenly the bucket erupts in flames.) Whoa! What is that?! (She sniffs the cup.) (To the guy.) It’s nine o’clock in the morning!

content.description: Chandler, Joey, and Ross’s, Ross is reading what Joey wrote.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: All right. (Reading.) A room. A man enters, he looks suspicious. (Stops reading a flips the page to find the next one is blank.) That’s it? (Joey shrugs.) Joey, you’re supposed to have five pages done by now! Including an exciting incident! (Flipping through the rest of the pad.) And what is, and what is all this?! (Reading.) The official rulebook of Fireball.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, that’s the uh, game we were playing.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh yeah, it’s great! See you take a tennis ball, a bowl, and some lighter fluid—Op! Op! (He puts out a small fire which has re-ignited in his room.)
content.parenthetical: entering from his room carrying a fire extinguisher and wearing oven mitts

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: This is helping your career?! Huh? I thought you wanted to be an actor not the creator of crazy lawsuit game!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You’re right, you’re right, I’ll get back to work.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: And shame on you! You should know better, Joey needs to work. (To Joey) Now come on!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey!
(He tries to fire a burnt tennis ball into the bowl Chandler is standing by, but Ross grabs the ball away from him.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No! Ah-ah-ah-ah-ah! You can have this back when the five pages are done! (After Joey walks past, Ross throws the ball down in pain.) Ahh! (Chandler shows him the burn spots on his oven mitts.)

content.description: Outside Danny’s apartment, Danny and Rachel are returning from their date.

content.speaker: Danny
content.text: I had a really nice time tonight.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: So did I. I’m really glad Monica asked us out.
(He kisses her.)

content.speaker: Danny
content.text: I’d love to ask you in, but uh, my sister’s visiting and I think she’s asleep on the couch.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You’re sister? You’re sister’s asleep on the couch? (Danny nods, “Yes.”) Ohhh! I saw her with you on the subway and now she’s asleep on the couch!

content.speaker: Danny’s Sister
content.text: Oh, I thought I heard you.

content.speaker: Danny
content.text: Oh hey, great, you’re up. Rachel, this is my sister Krista. Krista, this is Rachel.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Krista
content.text: Nice to meet you. I wish you’d told me we were having company, I’d fix myself up!

content.speaker: Danny
content.text: Like it would help.

content.speaker: Krista
content.text: You are so bad! (Hits him softly.)

content.speaker: Danny
content.text: You are! (Hits her back.)

content.speaker: Krista
content.text: You are! (Hits him softly.)

content.speaker: Danny
content.text: You are! (Hits her back.)

content.speaker: Krista
content.text: You are! (Hits him softly.)

content.speaker: Danny
content.text: You are! (Hits her back.)

content.speaker: Krista
content.text: You are! (Hits him harder this time.)

content.speaker: Danny
content.text: You are so dead! I’m gonna get you.
(He starts chasing her around Rachel a couple of times before she runs into the living room and he tackles her on the couch where he starts tickling her.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Uh, it was very nice meeting you. (They continue to ignore her.)

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Phoebe is complaining to Ross and Monica about the bucket.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Nobody! Nobody respects the bucket! You wouldn’t believe what people put in here! Look! (Hands it to Monica.) Okay, does this look like a garbage can to you?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Does it look like an ashtray?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Does it look like a urinal?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Eww!! (Throws the bucket down.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: So Pheebs, are you gonna go back out there or what?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, yeah! But I’m not gonna take anymore crap. Okay? No more Mrs. Nice Bucket!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah, good for you. Y’know you’re tough, you lived on the streets.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, I’m gonna go back to being Street Phoebe. Yeah! Oh but, y’know what? I can’t go totally back because Street Phoebe really wouldn’t be friends with you guys. Sorry. (Leaves.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey, umm, can I ask you guys something?

content.speaker: Monica and Ross
content.text: Sure.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Uh, I don’t have any brothers so I don’t know, but uh, did you guys wrestle?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh-oh, yeah.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: All the time. In fact, I was undefeated.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Uh, you weighted 200 pounds.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Still, I was quick as a cat.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, I met Danny’s sister yesterday, and uh that was actually the girl on the subway.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, you’re kidding.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, they were very y’know…wrestley. But, I guess that’s normal?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: We don’t, we don’t wrestle now.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, not since I got too strong for you.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Too strong for me?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You wanna go right now? ’Cause I’ll take you right now, buddy! You wanna go?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh fine.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ready? (They grab a hold of each other’s necks.) Wrestle! (They start wrestling.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay, y’know what uh, actually, that’s great. That helps a lot. Thanks. (She leaves them to wrestle.)

content.description: Chandler, Joey, and Ross’s, Ross is cleaning the foosball table, Joey is working on his script.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Guys, come on! Let’s go! The puck drops in 20 minutes! Come on, Joe!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Joey’s not going.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I didn’t finish my five pages.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, why can’t you do them tomorrow?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Because tomorrow he’s redoing yesterday’s pages.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yesterday’s pages did not reflect my best work.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Why don’t you cut him a little slack? Okay? Maybe if he relaxes a little bit, he’ll get some work done.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I think he’s been relaxing enough, thanks to you and Fireball.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Dude, if you think Fireball’s relaxing, you’ve obviously have never played.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: The only reason you’re doing this to Joey is because you’re bored. Okay, it’s not his fault that you’re unemployed.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I am not unemployed. I’m on sabbatical!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Come on look guys, don’t fight.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: And the reason I’m doing this is because I am Joey’s friend. And if you were a good friend, you’d be doing the same thing.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, so being a good friend means acting like a total jerk?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: If it does? Then you’re an amazing friend of mine.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey-hey guys, hey! How about we settle this over a friendly game of Fireball? Huh? I’ll go unhook the smoke detectors!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: How about we settle this right now! (He rips up the tickets.) There! Now, no one’s going to the game. Ha-ha-ha!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I paid for those tickets!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No you didn’t. You said you would, but you never did!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh yeah! (Makes an unintelligible taunting sound.)

content.description: Central Perk, Monica, Rachel, Joey, and Chandler are listening to a story being told by Danny and his sister.

content.speaker: Danny
content.text: …so we finally get to the top of the mountain and airhead here (His sister) forgets the camera!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, y’know the same thing happened to me one time.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: When did that happen to you?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Don’t you remember when we were jogging in the park and we saw that really pretty bird and wanted to take a picture—I didn’t have my camera!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh yeah. First off all, chasing the Churo guy isn’t jogging.

content.speaker: Krista
content.text: Oh, this is so good (A piece of cake.) you have got to try it. (She takes some on her finger and feeds it to Danny. Then takes a little more and does it again. Meanwhile, the rest of the gang stares on in shock. Then they pick up a part of it and some filling falls into his lap.)

content.speaker: Danny
content.text: Oh, damn! I got it on my pants.

content.speaker: Krista
content.text: Here, I’ll get it. (She grabs a napkin and tries to wipe it up. The thing that gets the rest of the gang going is that she’s whipping awfully close to his crotch. In fact, she is whipping his crotch. Chandler’s about to come out of his chair.)

content.speaker: Krista
content.text: We’d better take these pants off upstairs or that stain’s gonna set.

content.speaker: Danny
content.text: Yep. (To Rachel) I’m gonna wear these on our date tonight.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, great!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, bye! (To the gang.) Oh my God!!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: That was unbelievable!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay, see? I told you!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, wow, sorry Rach.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I don’t believe they’re brother and sister.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: They’re brother and sister!!!

content.description: [Scene: In front of Macys, Phoebe has adorned her bucket with numerous signs. Like “We are not a urinal!” and “I have no Macys info.” And other stuff like that. She also has a scowl on her face as she is ringing her bell. A little old lady walks up to make a donation but Phoebe stops her.]

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh whoa-whoa-whoa! Wait a minute, open up your hand; let me take a look. (The lady opens up her hand.) Quarter. Dime. Lint? Not interested in that. (She throws the lint away.) What’s this? A Canadian coin? Get outta here! (The lady walks away.)
(Another man walks up with a drink in his hand, Phoebe stops him too.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Whoa-whoa-whoa! No drinks near the bucket! Set it down over there and then you can make a contribution! (The guy starts to walk away with a hurt look on his face.) And you can leave the hurt bunny look over there too! (Her boss and a co-worker walk up.) Hi Bob! (The same old lady from before walks bye.) (To the old lady.) I thought I told you to get outta here!

content.speaker: Bob
content.text: Uh, Phoebe we’ve been getting complaints and uh, we’re gonna move you to a less high-profile spot.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Bob
content.text: Umm, Ginger’s gonna take over this corner.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: That chick can’t handle my corner.

content.speaker: Bob
content.text: Look, either you leave, or we remove you.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Fine. (She hands her bell to Ginger and starts to take down her signs.) (The same old lady walks by again.) All right, I’ll give you one pointer. Look out for that bitch. (The old lady.)

content.description: Danny’s apartment, there’s a knock on the door and he answers it.

content.speaker: Danny
content.text: Oh, hey Rach! I thought we said seven?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah uh, y’know what uh, let’s skip it.

content.speaker: Danny
content.text: What?! Why?!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Umm, you-you and your sister seem to have umm, a very special bond, and…

content.speaker: Danny
content.text: Oh great! That special bond again! Why do women have such a problem with the fact that I’m close with my sister?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, okay, look. I don’t know, listen, I don’t know what’s going on here but let’s…

content.speaker: Danny
content.text: Do-do you, do you have brothers?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No, I have two sisters. But one of them has a very masculine energy.

content.speaker: Danny
content.text: Are you close with them?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No-no, they’re not very nice people.

content.speaker: Danny
content.text: Okay, listen, I really like you. Okay? I think this can go somewhere. So what if I’m close to my family, are you gonna let that stand in the way of us?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, uh, I-I don’t know. See when-when you put it that way y’know it does sort of…

content.speaker: Krista
content.text: Danny! Hurry up! The bath is getting cold!

content.speaker: Danny
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, okay, I’ll see you later. (Gets up and runs from the apartment.)

content.description: Chandler, Joey, and Ross’s, Ross is there as Chandler enters.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh hey! There’s some kids playing in the street, you wanna go down there and give them a project, ruin their day?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey, if they have a ball maybe you can stick razor blades in it and teach them a new game, Gonna Need Stitches Ball.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey guys! I was at the library all morning and I already finished my five pages for today!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yay!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Great! Now, we can go to the Ranger game! (Pause) Last night!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No dude, Ross tore up the tickets!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I guess when you don’t have so many distractions, it’s easier for you to focus. Huh?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah or also when you don’t have somebody breathing down your neck ALL THE LIVE LONG DAY!!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, well, that’s fine, but the important thing is that I finished it. And uh, I think it’s really good, but y’know it’d really help me is if I could hear it. So would you guys read it for me?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: All right. (Takes a copy.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: All right. (Takes another copy.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay. (Reading.) “It’s a typical New York City apartment. Two guys are hanging out.” Ross (Points to him.)
(Ross and Chandler start to read Joey’s script aloud.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey man.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What is up?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: About yesterday, I was really wrong. I am sorry.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No, it was me. I’m sorry. I over reacted.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Maybe it was both of us, but we had our best friend’s interest… (Pauses and looks at Joey.) But we had our best friend’s interest at heart.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Could I be more sorry. (Looks at Joey.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I don’t know, I’m one sorry polentologist. (Stops reading.) All right Joey, we get it. (To Chandler) I’m sorry.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I’m sorry too.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh no! No-no, keep reading! The good part’s coming up. Keep going.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I am sorry, Chandler.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I am sorry, Ross.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: A handsome man enters. (Playing the part of the handsome man.) Hey! How’s it going guys? I don’t know what you two were talking about, but I’d like to say thanks to both of you. You, (Ross) you wouldn’t let me give up on myself, and you (Chandler) well you co-created Fireball. The end.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: This took you all day?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No-no, this only took five minutes. I spent the rest of the day coming up with new, Ultimate Fireball. (Takes out a bowling ball and a propane torch.) Ha-ha!

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Monica and Rachel are about to read another one of Joey’s efforts.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay, it’s a typical New York City apartment. Two girls are just hanging out.
(Monica and Rachel begin to read from the script.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hi, how are you doing Kelly?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I’m doing just fine! God, Tiffany, you smell so great!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: It’s my new perfume. Why don’t you come closer where you can really appreciate it?
(They both start to read ahead.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, y’know Joey, you are sick!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: This is disgusting!
(They both throw the scripts in his face.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I’m not reading this!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What?! Wait-wait-wait! The handsome man was about to enter!!
